> 
> So, m=
aybe a binary choice isn't necessary.  Just fork it!
> 
> 
> Please don't. =
 We're already complaining about the list being too
> low-volume.  If you f=
ork it, each list ends up being even lower 
volume.  If
> in fact message v=
olume plays a role in getting people to join the 
list, we'd
> be shooting =
ourselves in the foot.
> 

I agree with John here.  I think forking the gro=
up is trying to 
solve a problem we don't have.  If we had too much volume =
it would 
be a good idea, but our problem is the opposite so there's no nee=
d 
at present to split the community in two.  So regardless of what we 
do =
(i.e. open or close) with the archive, I think we should stick 
together as=
 one group.

ken
